Entities.Name: Medication
Entities.Definition: Any mention of drug names within the EHR text.

Entities.Name: Indication
Entities.Definition: The condition or disease that the medication is being used to treat.
Entities.Sample Data: Indication for Aspirin is thrombosis prevention.

Entities.Name: Adverse Drug Event (ADE)
Entities.Definition: Any injuries or adverse conditions resulting from the administration of a drug.
Entities.Sample Data: Patient experienced severe gastrointestinal bleeding after taking Aspirin.

Entities.Name: Frequency
Entities.Definition: How often a drug is taken, as mentioned in the EHR.
Entities.Sample Data: Metformin to be taken twice daily.

Entities.Name: Severity
Entities.Definition: The intensity of an ADE or condition.

Entities.Name: Dosage
Entities.Definition: The amount of medication prescribed or taken by the patient.

Entities.Name: Duration
Entities.Definition: The length of time the patient has been or will be taking the medication.

Entities.Name: Route
Entities.Definition: The method of administration of the medication.

Entities.Name: SSLIF
Entities.Definition: Signs, symptoms, and other factors not classified under ADEs or indications but related to patient health.

Dataset.Name: MADE 1.0
Dataset.Details: The dataset consists of 1089 EHR notes of cancer patients used for training and testing models to detect medications and ADEs.

Annotation Guidelines.Supplemental Materials: See Multimedia Appendix for additional information on model training and experimental settings.
